stanza.line: How sweet and lovely dost thou make the shameshame
Which like a canker in the fragrant roserose
Doth spot the beauty of thy budding namename
O in what sweets dost thou thy sins encloseenclose
That tongue that tells the story of thy daysdays
Cannot dispraise but in a kind of praisepraise
Naming thy name blesses an ill reportreport
O what a mansion have those vices gotgot
Which for their habitation chose out theethee
Where beauty veil doth cover every blotblot
And all things turns to fair that eyes can seesee
Take heed (dear heart) of this large privilegeprivilege
The hardest knife ill-used doth lose his edgeedge
